readme:
# lucid-syntax

[![apm][apm-badge]][apm]

An easily customisable syntax theme for Atom that employs a minimum set of
colours to optimise semantic clarity.

![demo][demo]

## Motivation

I created this theme after being discontent with using many other popular
syntax themes for Atom that:

1. Employ colours *too* liberally, which I feel is similar in clarity to
   reading a file with no syntax colouring at all.
2. Provide an impressive number of syntax colouring hooks, which can be
   extremely time consuming to get right if simply one wants to add one
   or two tweaks.

## Usage

Simply install this package via the *Install* tab in the *Settings View*
for Atom and select it to be the syntax theme using the dropdown in the
section opened by the *Theme* tab.

If you wish to customise this theme to your own liking, please see the
`styles/custom.less` file for guidance.

Please note that this theme is specifically reviewed for:

- C++
- CSS (SCSS, LESS)
- HTML
- JavaScript
- Markdown (GFM)
- Rust

It has also been tested against the default Atom UI themes
([Atom Dark][atom-dark], [Atom Light][atom-light], [One Dark][one-dark],
[One Light][one-light]) to ensure seamlessness.

## Notes

Automatically selected colours based off the primary colour follows the
[split complementary][split-comp] colour scheme plus the complementary colour.
